newsitem.title: USA: NYC mulls competitive or negotiated May bond sale.
newsitem.headline: NYC mulls competitive or negotiated May bond sale.

text.p: New York City, which sold through a negotiated syndicate Wednesday over $1.2 billion of tax-exempt and taxable bonds, has not yet determined whether to sell about $300 million of bonds in May through the same method or through a competitive auction, a city official said Thursday.
"We haven't decided yet," said the official, who declined to be named.
No time frame for when the city will make its decision on how to handle the sale of the tax-exempt, general obligation bonds was immediately available.
